bind.jr:requiredMsg: A comment on the access is a required selection.
Potential for Public Hazard is a required selection.
Surface Access Condition is a required selection.
Upstream Embankment Stability is a required selection.
Upstream Embankment Toe is a required selection.
Downstream Embankment Stability is a required selection.
Downstream Embankment Toe is a required selection.
Emergency Spillway Opening is a required selection.
Emergency Spillway Stability is a required selection.
Safe Water Depth is a required selection.
Orifice Trash Rack is a required selection.
Riser Trash Rack is a required selection.

Downstream Condition: ", /NPDES_Next_Gen_BMP_Inspect/g_bmp_inspect_crit/g_site_condition/ds_condition , "

Outfall: ", /NPDES_Next_Gen_BMP_Inspect/g_bmp_inspect_crit/g_pond_riser/spwy_out , "
Fences: ", /NPDES_Next_Gen_BMP_Inspect/g_bmp_inspect_crit/g_site_condition/fences )

bind.jr:requiredMsg: Field Matches Plan is a required selection.

input.label: Facility ID
input.hint: This is a unique facility ID that links the inspection back to the SWMFAC table.

input.label: Inspector
input.hint: First initial and last name (no space) of the members of the inspection team.

select1.label: Firm Group
select1.hint: Refer to the instructions to select your group number.

input.label: Not Scored -vs- Not Rated
input.hint:
Not Rated (NR) means that the inspector could not access the feature to inspect. Not Rated is the default choice.

Not Scored (0) means that the inspection parameter is not part of the BMP design. Certain scores do not have a Not Part of BMP Design rating because they must be scored.

select1.label: Visibility
select1.hint: Scores the relative visibility of the facility from surrounding roadways, office complexes, shopping centers, residential areas, or other areas.

select1.label: Mowability
select1.hint: Scores the areas requiring routine mowing and slope considerations for allowing the mowing function to take place.

select1.label: BMP Access
select1.hint: Scores the existence of a maintenance access road and, if it exists, how well is it designed to meet SHA criteria.

input.label: Access Comment
input.hint: Describes issues relating to accessing a BMP site for field inspection or remedial actions.

select1.label: Debris
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the BMP related to the physical presence of unwanted woody / leafy material, garbage accumulations, and sedimentation that possibly can block the outlet structure.

select1.label: Fencing
select1.hint: Scores the fencing condition by considering placement and structural condition when fencing exists to secure the BMP (other than right-of-way fencing).

select1.label: Public Hazard
select1.hint: Evaluates the evidence of trespassing, temporary habitation, or downstream occupancy.

select1.label: Potential for Public Hazard
select1.hint: Scores the <u>potential</u> for trespassing or temporary habitation based upon surrounding land uses.

select1.label: BMP Vegetation
select1.hint: This parameter must be evaluated during the growing season from May 15 to October 30; otherwise the specific vegetation cannot be adequately assessed.

select1.label: Site Vegetation
select1.hint: Should be scored during the growing season from the dates of May 15 to October 30. Site vegetation will always have a score of NR between May 15th and October 30th unless conditions warrant a 3, 4, or 5 rating of the parameter.

select1.label: BMP Contamination
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the BMP related to residue of contaminants from nearby activities or non-point source pollution within the watershed.

select1.label: Pre-Treatment
select1.hint: Scores the BMP feature(s) relating to pretreatment of stormwater prior to entering the treatment area.

select1.label: Inflow Stability
select1.hint: Scores the condition of flows into a BMP such as areas of sheet flow, swales, and storm drains discharging into the BMP.

select1.label: Inflow Condition
select1.hint: Scores the overall impact of the discharges into a BMP and their adverse effects that may impair the performance of the BMP.

select1.label: Downstream Condition
select1.hint: Scores the overall downstream channel conditions beyond the SHA ROW.

select1.label: Conveyance Stability
select1.hint: Scores the stability of flow conveyance through the stormwater treatment area.

select1.label: Surface Condition
select1.hint: Comments on the ground surface condition above pipe and around u/s and d/s structures

select1.label: Structure Access Condition
select1.hint: Comments on the facility access, such as broken ladder rungs, rusted lid, or a broken rim

select1.label: Upstream-Cover
select1.hint: This parameter scores the overall vegetative condition of the upstream slope of the embankment, including within 15 feet of the embankment toe, related to type, size and percent coverage. Typically, this is scored during the growing season from May 15 to October 30.

select1.label: Upstream Embankment Stability
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the upstream embankment stability related to erosion.

select1.label: Upstream Embankment Toe
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the upstream stability within 15 feet of the upstream toe of embankment.

select1.label: Downstream-Cover
select1.hint: This parameter scores the overall vegetative condition of the downstream slope of the embankment, including within 15 feet of the embankment toe, related to type, size and percent coverage. Typically, this is scored during the growing season from May 15 to October 30.

select1.label: Downstream Embankment Stability
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the downstream embankment stability related to erosion.

select1.label: Downstream Embankment Toe
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the downstream stability within 15 feet of the downstream toe of embankment.

select1.label: Embankment Seepage
select1.hint: Scores the condition of downstream embankment related to water seeping out.

select1.label: Emergency Spillway Opening
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the emergency spillway weir opening to function as designed when necessary.

select1.label: Emergency Spillway Stability
select1.hint: Scores the stability of the emergency spillway relating to erosion of sides and bottom.

select1.label: Safe Water Depth
select1.hint: Scores the potential safety risk to the public due to deep water.

select1.label: Ponding
select1.hint: Scores the accumulation of stormwater beyond 72 hours after a storm event resulting in loss of storage for water quality and / or detention.

input.label: Water Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Measurement of the depth of the excessive ponded water in the facility.

select1.label: Permanent Pooling
select1.hint: Scores the condition of BMPs with permanent standing water that is designed for water quality treatment.

select1.label: Orifice Opening
select1.hint: Scores the opening of the low-flow orifice to allow for proper drainage of the BMP.

select1.label: Orifice Trash Rack
select1.hint: Scores the structural condition of the trash rack on the low-flow orifice.

select1.label: Riser Opening
select1.hint: Scores the openings of the riser structure, weir, or end-section (also headwall) to allow for proper flow through the spillway.

select1.label: Riser Structure
select1.hint: Scores the overall structural integrity of the riser weir or outlet structure.

select1.label: Riser Sediment
select1.hint: Scores the amount of sediment accumulated inside the riser structure that could restrict the riser performance.

select1.label: Riser Trash Rack
select1.hint: Scores the structural condition of the trash rack on the riser structure.

select1.label: Riser Valve
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the valves and associated appurtenances of the riser.

select1.label: Spillway Outfall
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the outfall of the principle spillway and within 25 feet of the principal spillway structure.

select1.label: Principle Spillway
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the principle spillway (pipe / barrel).

input.label: MDOT SHA Response Needed
input.hint: This section allows for a response to comments made during previous inspection cycles.

input.label: Overall Comments
input.hint: This section allows for any additional comments, such as specific site conditions, maintenance requests, and any other additional information associated with the BMP.

select1.label: Rating
select1.hint: This rating is a qualitative evaluation of the individual parameters relating to environmental quality and sustainability to establish an overall rating value for the BMP facility.

select1.label: Field Matches Plan
select1.hint: BMP as observed in the field matches the set of plans being reviewed.

select1.label: Context
select1.hint: The exposure of the BMP to surrounding land uses.

select1.label: Occupation Hazard
select1.hint: An occupational hazard exists that future inspectors or maintenance individuals should be aware of.

select1.label: Action Comment
select1.hint: Action describing the maintenance or repair activities required as identified during the BMP inspection.

item.label: Rebuild Embankment to Provide Required Freeboard
Construct Concrete Apron at Access Road Entrance
Construct Depressed Curb at Access Road Entrance
Provide Opening in Traffic Barrier at Access Road
Remove Trees From SWM Embankment > 4 in. DBH
Mulch Straw or Wood Cellulose Fiber
Invasive Species Control Poison Ivy Control
Remove Trees from SWM Embankment = 4 in. Diameter Breast Height (DBH)
Repair or Replace Aggregate Filter Blanket
Lay Sod/ Grass on Bare Areas
Place Gate in Fence at Spillway

select.label: Action Location
select.hint: Location at which the action needs to take place.

select.label: Concern Type: Contaminants
select.hint: Select one or more contamination issues

select.label: Concern Type: Invasive Species
select.hint: Select one or more invasive species issues

input.label: Pipe Segment
input.hint: Select the segment number of the treatment pipe, based on the schematic. If the segment number is not on the schematic, such as when the field does not match plan, select a new number and annotate it.

select1.label: Underground Facility matches schematic
select1.hint: Does the schematic of the underground bmp facility pipe segments match the field?

select1.label: Pipe Material
select1.hint: Observed material of pipe

select1.label: Precleaned
select1.hint: Was this pipe cleaned prior to this inspection?

input.label: Estimated U/S Invert Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Depth from bottom of upstream structure to top of rim or top of structure

input.label: Estimated D/S Invert Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Depth from bottom of downstream structure to top of rim or top of structure

select1.label: Survey Direction
select1.hint: Direction that the underground survey follows

input.label: This issue tracker is for entering pipe issues as a function of the facility's length
Remark
input.hint: e.g. "Longitudinal crack at 0:12 sec, approx 8 inches long"

input.label: Instructions
input.hint: Check all that apply and circle a number of rating given. The worst defect along the individual storm drain length is used to give a single condition grade for that particular pipe length. The grade is based on the highest (worst) internal condition grade along the pipe length.

item.label: Road severely sagging/caving due to settlement and or closed to traffic
Partial or complete collapse of pipe
Deformation >10% and pipe broken or fractured
Extensive areas of pipe material missing and/or extensive perforations in pipe
Partial or complete collapse of endwall/headwall structure with embankment failure encroaching on roadway shoulder
Embankment failure near pipe encroaching on roadway shoulder
Multiple sections are out of alignment; pipe is not functioning

select.label: 4 Collapse likely in forseeable future
select.hint: The pipe will probably fail within 0-5 years

item.label: Evidence of roadway settlement or previous patching; depressions in roadway
Deformation up to 10% and pipe is broken
Pipe is broken or has multiple fractures; seams cracked 3 inches or more at bolts; evidence of efflorescence (whitish crystalline deposit on surface of concrete)
Misalignment and/or ponding from sagging segments shifted more than pipe thickness (significant infiltration/exfiltration at joints; fill visible)
Major undermining of pipe/structure; evidence of piping {runoff along outside of pipe eroding soil around and beneath)
Partial or complete collapse of endwall/headwall structure with embankment failure NOT encroaching on roadway shoulder
Embankment failure near pipe NOT encroaching on roadway shoulder
Extensive areas of spalling (chipping/splintering concrete) or slabbing (large slabs of concrete peeling) with exposed corroding reinforcing steel
Extensive areas of corrosion/rust with scattered perforations and deep pitting
Large areas of wearing greater than 0.5 inches deep (removal and deformation of surface material in pipe)

select.label: 3 Collapse unlikely in near future but further deterioration likely
select.hint: The pipe may fail in 5-10 years

item.label: Longitudinal cracking, multiple cracks or significant seam cracking near bolts on metal pipes
Minor horizontal or vertical displacement of pipe segments (less than pipe thickness); alignment beginning to change
Minor to moderate perforations in pipe, scattered heavy rust and/or deep pitting
Large open joints or medium joint displacement (over I times the pipe wall thickness) allowing backfill or water infiltration at joints
Minor undermining of pipe/structure; possible piping
End structure separated from pipe segments
Significant cracks or spalling and/or large areas of scaling (peeling or flaking less than 0.25 inches deep); isolated locations of exposed reinforcing steel
Medium areas of wearing less than 0.5 inches deep

select.label: 2 Minimum collapse risk in short term but potential for further deterioration
select.hint: The pipe unlikely to fail for at least 10-20 years

item.label: Moderate rust with no perforations; slight pitting
Minor pipe distortion or misalignment due to settlement or excessive loads
Minor joint defects; medium open joint or small joint separation (less than 1.0 times pipe thickness), joints deteriorated at isolated locations
Minor hairline cracks or minor cracking at bolt holes
Small areas of wearing, spalling or scaling (finished concrete surface chunks cracking off) on invert present
Pipe full of sediment/debris- needs to be cleaned

select1.label: Subject
select1.hint: Standard photo subjects
